headline.main: Hon. Charles Sumner at Heidelberg.; From the Boston Straight Republican.

docs.lead_paragraph: MY DEAR--: Weeks have now passed since I have seen a letter or a newspaper from home. During this time I have been travelling away from news, and I am now famished. On my arrival at Antwerp, I trust to find letters at last.
docs.snippet: MY DEAR--: Weeks have now passed since I have seen a letter or a newspaper from home. During this time I have been travelling away from news, and I am now famished. On my arrival at Antwerp, I trust to find letters at last.

headline.main: A Remarkable Case of Going Without Food.

docs.lead_paragraph: SIR: Saw in your daily of Oct. 2, an article in which reference is made to a correspondent of the Albany Evening Journal in regard to remarkable care of going without eating. You say:
docs.snippet: SIR: Saw in your daily of Oct. 2, an article in which reference is made to a correspondent of the Albany Evening Journal in regard to remarkable care of going without eating. You say:

docs.lead_paragraph: SUICIDA.--A butcher named GEORGE MEE, living in South Fourth-street, Jersey-City, committed suicide on Wednesday by taking laudanum. He put the poison into a glass of water and then, stepping into an adjoining room where his wife and (a lady visitor were sitting, tipped the glass to them, proposed their health and swallowed the dose without exciting their suspicions as to his Intentions.

headline.main: The Doings and Habits of a First-Class Scoundrel.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Courrier dcs Etats Unis. Some time ago we had occasion to relate, as an incident of the current history of New-York, a scandalous affair that look place at one of our most in ??tonalie hotels. It was the story of a young man caught in a false position by an injured husband, and escaping by a right, as ridiculous as it was precipitate, the consequences of the unexpected surprise.

headline.main: LOSS OF THE BRIG JEROME KNIGHT.; Eleven Persons Five on Wreck--The Captain's Wife and Infant Child among the number--Another Thrilling Story of Suffering at Sen.

docs.lead_paragraph: The brig Jerome Knight, Capt. HIRAM PERKINS, was wrecked on the 23d ult. off the coast of North Carolina. The vessel belongs to Messrs. WHITON, BROWN WHEELRIGHT, in Boston, and had left Wilmington, N.C., loaded with lumber for Marseilles and a market. She was a staunch-built vessel, only a year and a half old, and already rode out two or three violent gales.
